column1: 0~Guardians Of The Galaxy~Chris Pratt apparently stole his Star-Lord costume from the set
column2: for the sole purpose of having it available so he could show up in costume to visit sick children in the hospital
column3: who might want to meet Star-Lord.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b693f66ffa8__700.jpg

column1: 1~The Theory Of Everything~In an e-mail to director James Marsh about the portrayal by Eddie Redmayne
column2: Stephen Hawking said there were certain points when he thought he was watching himself. In addition to his copyrighted voice
column3: Stephen Hawking also lent the filmmakers his Companion of Honour medal and his signed thesis to use as genuine props in the film.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-109-5a560508045b3__700.jpg

column1: 2~Armageddon~NASA shows this film during their management training program. New managers are given the task of trying to spot as many errors as possible. At least one hundred sixty-eight have been found.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-99-5a560ed0840f8__700.jpg
3~Dallas Buyers Club~The film's budget was so low that the makeup budget was $250. The film's artists were able to work with that
column2: and the film's Makeup and Hairstyling won an Oscar.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a0ef96f59505__700.jpg

column1: 4~The Godfather~The cat held by Marlon Brando in the opening scene was a stray that Coppola found while on the lot at Paramount
column2: and was not originally called for in the script. So content was the cat that its purring muffled some of Brando's dialogue
column3: and
column4: as a result
column5: most of his lines had to be looped.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-102-5a55e6f68fc15__700.jpg

column1: 5~The Matrix~Kung Fu choreographer Woo-Ping Yuen initially refused to work on the film
column2: and hoped that by asking for an exorbitant fee
column3: it would turn off the Wachowskis. It didn't. He next formulated what he considered an impossible request. He said that he'd agree only if he had complete control of the fights
column4: and that he trained the actors for four months before they shoot. The Wachowskis complied with his request.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a81e328254a__700.jpg

column1: 6~Elizabeth: The Golden Age~In the film
column2: when Elizabeth arrives at St. Paul's Cathedral
column3: construction is going on. In real life
column4: St. Paul's actually needed repair work. Director Shekhar Kapur decided to improvise
column5: and gave the workers costumes and period tools to cut real stone that was being installed in the cathedral. The workers in the scene are real-life stonemasons and construction workers.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2a623691fc7__700.jpg

column1: 7~Django Unchained~When Calvin Candie (Leonardo DiCaprio) smashes his hand on the dinner table
column2: DiCaprio accidentally crushed a small stemmed glass with his palm and really began to bleed. He ignored it
column3: stayed in character
column4: and continued with the scene. Quentin Tarantino was so impressed that he used this take in the final print
column5: and when he called cut
column6: the room erupted in a standing ovation.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b7ca89d1abe__700.jpg

column1: 8~Forrest Gump~Tom Hanks was not paid for this film. Instead
column2: he took percentage points which ultimately netted him in the region of forty million dollars.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59bbe693ce3aa__700.jpg

column1: 9~Titanic~After finding out that she had to be naked in front of Leonardo DiCaprio
column2: Kate Winslet decided to break the ice
column3: and when they first met
column4: she flashed him.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-104-5a55e8e69d3c1__700.jpg

column1: 10~Schindler's List~To gather costumes for 20
column2: 000 extras
column3: the costume designer took out advertisements seeking clothes. As economic conditions were poor in Poland
column4: many people were eager to sell clothing they still owned from the 1930s and '40s.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-108-5a5600de938cd__700.jpg

column1: 11~The Chronicles Of Narnia: The Lion
column2: The Witch And The Wardrobe~Georgie Henley's reaction to Mr. Tumnus at the lamppost is genuine. She had not seen her castmate James McAvoy in his costume before the scene was filmed
column3: so her screams and reaction were real. Georgie's first reaction to the snowy world of Narnia is also genuine. She was carried into the set blindfolded to make her first entrance
column4: and her wide-eyed
column5: delighted reactions to it
column6: all are entirely her own.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2a6c3f12e83__700.jpg

column1: 12~The Dark Knight~In preparation for his role as The Joker
column2: Heath Ledger hid away in a motel room for about six weeks. During this extended stay of seclusion
column3: Ledger delved deep into the psychology of the character. He devoted himself to developing The Joker's every tic
column4: namely the voice and that sadistic-sounding laugh.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/interesting-movie-facts-3-59a80cefbcafd__700.jpg

column1: 13~John Wick: Chapter 2~Keanu Reeves performed about 95 percent of the fight scenes himself. To prepare for the role
column2: Keanu trained for three months. His training consisted of Judo
column3: Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu
column4: marksmanship
column5: and driving.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a8164e0b949__700.jpg

column1: 14~The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring~The cast often had to fly to remote shoot locations by helicopter. Sean Bean (Boromir) was afraid of flying
column2: and would only do it when absolutely necessary. When they were shooting the scenes of the Fellowship crossing the snowy mountains
column3: he'd spend two hours every morning
column4: climbing from the base of the mountain
column5: to the set near the top
column6: already dressed as Boromir. The crew being flown up

column1: 15~Pretty Woman~Edward (Richard Gere) snapping the necklace case down on Vivian's (Julia Roberts) fingers
column2: was improvised by Gere
column3: and Roberts's reaction (laughter) was totally natural. The filmmakers liked it so much
column4: they decided to leave it in.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b78f13b88e2__700.jpg

column1: 16~Interstellar~For a cornfield scene
column2: Christopher Nolan sought to grow five hundred acres of corn
column3: which he learned was feasible from his producing of Man of Steel (2013). The corn was then sold
column4: and actually made a profit.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-100-5a5469cf481f0__700.jpg

column1: 17~The Terminator~One afternoon during a break in filming
column2: Arnold Schwarzenegger went into a restaurant in downtown L.A. to get some lunch and realized all too late that he was still in Terminator makeup - with a missing eye
column3: exposed jawbone and burned flesh.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-41-5a55ec487744c__700.jpg

column1: 18~Star Trek~The sound of the automatic doors opening on the U.S.S. Enterprise
column2: is a Russian train's toilet flushing.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a280bd6d4b56__700.jpg

column1: 19~The Revenant~Leonardo DiCaprio chose to devour a raw slab of bison's liver
column2: even though he is vegetarian. He also had to learn to shoot a musket
column3: build a fire
column4: speak two Native American languages (Pawnee and Arikara)
column5: and study with a doctor who specializes in ancient healing techniques. DiCaprio calls it the hardest performance of his career.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b78c6d6da97__700.jpg

column1: 20~Jurassic Park~The sounds the Velociraptors make when communicating is the same sound tortoises make when having sex.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-42-5a5600189ca00__700.jpg
21~The Imitation Game~"Benedict Cumberbatch confessed that in one of the final scenes of the film
column2: he couldn't stop crying and had a breakdown. It was
column3: as he said
column4: ""Being an actor or a person that had grown incredibly fond of the character and thinking what he had suffered and how that had affected him."""~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a0db301f1f11__700.jpg

column1: 22~I Am Legend~Will Smith grew so enamored of his canine co-star
column2: Abbey
column3: that he tried to adopt her when filming was finished
column4: but the dog's trainer could not be persuaded to give her up.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-84-5a560a773571c__700.jpg

column1: 23~Man Of Steel~Henry Cavill refused to take steroids to muscle up for the role. He also refused any digital touch-ups or enhancement to his body in his shirtless scenes. He said it would have been dishonest of him to use trickery while playing Superman
column2: and he wanted to push his body to the limits
column3: to develop his physique into one that was worthy of the character.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59d773d9075ab__700.jpg

column1: 24~Slumdog Millionaire~Director Danny Boyle placed the money to be paid to the 3 lead child actors in a trust that is to be released to them upon their completion of grade school at 16 years of age. The production company has set up for an auto-rikshaw driver to take the kids to school everyday until they are 16 years old.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2a4505243ba__700.jpg
25~The Shawshank Redemption~"When Andy goes to the library to begin work as Brooks' assistant and Brooks' crow
column2: Jake
column3: is squawking
column4: Tim Robbins had to time his line
column5: ""Hey
column6: Jake. Where's Brooks?"" so that the crow wouldn't squawk over him
column7: since the bird could not be trained to squawk on cue. Robbins was able to adapt to this and time his line perfectly by learning the bird's squawking patterns
column8: for which Writer and Director Frank Darabont praised him. Robbins' improvisation is noticeable
column9: as he watches the bird carefully while approaching it
column11: and doesn't begin his line until after it does so."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a95cbe6852a__700.jpg

column1: 26~The Martian~Matt Damon admitted that the scene where Mark was getting emotional upon hearing Commander Lewis' voice was genuine. The other actors had wrapped and gone home
column2: and their pre-recorded voices were actually being played to Damon from inside his spacesuit. When Damon began to think about how his character had been all alone on Mars for two years
column3: alongside how he was only hearing pre-recorded voices of his co-stars who had already finished their scenes
column4: he began to tear up. Ridley Scott was so impressed with Damon's performance
column5: that he only did one take of the scene
column6: which was used in the film.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b78d3322b7a__700.jpg

column1: 27~Titanic~The scenes set in 1912
column2: i.e. the whole movie except the present-day scenes and the opening and ending credits
column3: have a total length of two hours and forty minutes
column4: the exact time it took for Titanic to sink. Also
column5: the collision with the iceberg reportedly lasted 37 seconds
column6: which is how long the collision scene is in the movie.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-30-5a55e96b96cb1__700.jpg

column1: 28~I Am Legend~While doing a press conference in Japan for the release of the movie
column2: Will Smith accidentally revealed the ending to a collection of entertainment reporters. Warner Bros. asked the reporters and all those present to withhold the ending
column3: and the reporters all obliged without any pay-off or consideration.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-111-5a560baa697f5__700.jpg

column1: 29~Saving Private Ryan~Tom Sizemore was battling a drug addiction during production. Steven Spielberg gave him an ultimatum that he would be blood tested on the set every day of filming
column2: and if he failed the test once he would be fired and the part of Horvath would be recast and re-shot with someone else
column3: even if it was at the end of production.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a80fb909ca1__700.jpg

column1: 30~Wonder Woman~Gal Gadot was a part of re-shoots for the movie (including stunts) while being five months pregnant. Her baby bump was visible
column2: so the crew created a costume which had a green screen around her belly
column3: which was later removed during post-production.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b7ccdf750d9__700.jpg

column1: 31~Into The Woods~At a Q&A session after screening of the film
column2: James Corden recalled an incident during rehearsals in which Meryl Streep jumped on a table and her foot got caught in her costume. She started falling backwards
column3: head first
column4: toward a concrete floor. Both Corden and director Rob Marshall froze in the fear that they were about to witness the death of Meryl Streep. However
column5: a pregnant Emily Blunt stepped in and caught Streep before she hit the floor.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a0ef3eee59d2__700.jpg

column1: 32~Maleficent~"Angelina Jolie admitted that she scared little kids while in costume on the set of Maleficent
column2: with one kid actually saying
column3: ""Mommy
column4: please get the mean witch to stop talking to me."" She adds that her daughter
column5: Vivienne Jolie-Pitt
column6: who played young Aurora
column7: was the only child who was not scared of her."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a0db231840be__700.jpg

column1: 33~The Theory Of Everything~"Eddie Redmayne met with Stephen Hawking only once before filming. ""In the three hours I spent with him
column2: he said maybe eight sentences
column3: recalls Redmayne. ""I just didn't feel like I could ask him intimate things."" Therefore
column4: he found other ways to prepare for the role. He lost about 15 pounds and trained for four months with a dancer to learn how to control his body. He met with 40 ALS patients
column5: kept a chart tracking the order in which Hawking's muscles declined
column6: and stood in front of a mirror for hours on end
column8: he remained motionless and hunched over between takes
column9: so much so that an osteopath told him he had altered the alignment of his spine. ""I fear I'm a bit of a control freak
column10: Redmayne admits. ""I was obsessive. I'm not sure it was healthy."""~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-62-5a56040ea3c43__700.jpg

column1: 34~The Devil Wears Prada~"On the first day of filming
column2: Meryl Streep told Anne Hathaway
column3: ""I think you're perfect for the role. I'm so happy we're going to be working together."" Then she paused and followed it up with
column4: ""That's the last nice thing I'll say to you."" And it was.

column1: Many fashion designers allowed their clothes and accessories to be used in the film
column2: making it the most expensively-costumed film in history. Meryl Streep donated her wardrobe to a charity auction."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2a64d90b120__700.jpg

column1: 35~Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them~Wand school was obligatory for several of the cast members. The actors and actresses would attend a boot camp
column2: in order to be instructed how to move and use a wand properly.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59aea9631b2a6__700.jpg

column1: 36~Rocky IV~Sylvester Stallone wanted to make sure the boxing scenes looked real in Rocky IV
column2: so he instructed Dolph Lundgren to actually hit him. A punch to the chest left Stallone in intensive care for four days.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b78fdae9f64__700.jpg

column1: 37~Black Swan~Natalie Portman not only trained for a year as a dancer to prepare for the role
column2: but paid for the the training out of her own pocket until the film found investors. Aronofsky attributed the film's getting made at all to Portman's dedication and enthusiasm.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a20142b02e36__700.jpg

column1: 38~Fight Club~Brad Pitt and Edward Norton both really learned how to make soap.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a976bc6c65c__700.jpg

39~Cast Away~To make himself look like an average out of shape middle aged man Tom Hanks didn't exercise and allowed himself to grow pudgy. Production was then halted for a year so he could lose fifty pounds and grow out his hair for his time spent on the deserted island.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/interesting-movie-facts-1-59a80cebba20b__700.jpg
40~The Mummy~"Brendan Fraser nearly died during a scene where his character is hanged. Rachel Weisz remembered
column2: ""He stopped breathing and had to be resuscitated."""~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a439cb9bd977__700.jpg

column1: 41~The Terminator~Arnold Schwarzenegger worked with guns every day for a month to prepare for the role. The first two weeks of filming he practiced weapons stripping and reassembly blindfolded until the motions were automatic
column2: like a machine. He spent hours at the shooting range and practicing with different weapons without blinking or looking at them when reloading or cocking. He also had to be ambidextrous.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-106-5a55ee2a509d8__700.jpg

column1: 42~Get Out~Daniel Kaluuya was given the lead role on the spot after nailing his audition. Jordan Peele said Kaluuya did about five takes of a key scene
column2: in which his character needs to cry
column3: and each was so perfect that the single tear came down at the exact same time for each take.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-116-5a5630e92fda9__700.jpg

column1: 43~12 Years A Slave~In order to better portray an alcoholic
column2: Michael Fassbender had his makeup artist paint his mustache with alcohol so that the other actors would react naturally to the smell
column3: as they would to a man who had been drinking heavily.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a81f2048693__700.jpg

column1: 44~Candyman~The bees were bred specifically for this movie. They needed to make sure that the bees were only twelve hours old
column2: so that they looked like mature bees
column3: but their stinger wouldn't be powerful enough to do any real damage.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b7d7b5af3e9__700.jpg

column1: 45~Iron Man~Paul Bettany has never seen the film
column2: and is unfamiliar with the plot. He said J.A.R.V.I.S. was the easiest job ever
column3: and it was almost like a robbery
column4: since he only worked for two hours
column5: got paid a lot of money
column6: then went on vacation with his wife (Jennifer Connelly).~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59afbaac160ce__700.jpg

column1: 46~Kingsman: The Secret Service~"In the film and trailer
column2: when the new Kingsman recruits have their first night's sleep interrupted by a deluge of water pouring into the dorm
column3: on-set the scene went horrifically wrong. As Matthew Vaughn recalls ""I shouted 'action!'
column4: the computer got it wrong and vrrrrssshh
column5: everyone was twenty feet down underwater. Cameras
column6: sound guys... Guys were in waders full of water
column8: everyone diving in and pulling people out."" The set
column9: painstakingly planned and rehearsed using height markers and computer-programmed water tanks
column10: washed away in a near-biblical flood when said computers went rogue. ""Those actors weren't acting
column12: shudders Vaughn. ""It was awful for the first day of filming."""~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a0daaee78553__700.jpg

column1: 47~Logan~Sir Patrick Stewart lost 21 pounds to play Charles Xavier as elderly and sick. Stewart claimed that he had a steady weight since he was a teenager and had never deliberately lost weight before.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a81a8ec7586__700.jpg
48~The Godfather~During an early shot of the scene where Vito Corleone returns home and his people carry him up the stairs
column2: Marlon Brando put weights under his body on the bed as a prank
column3: to make it harder to lift him.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-103-5a55e7eea06ef__700.jpg

column1: 49~Prometheus~Composer Marc Streitenfeld had the orchestra play his compositions backwards
column2: and then digitally reversed the compositions for the final film. This made the music sound unusual and unsettling
column3: which he felt was right for the film.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a12ecd13aace__700.jpg

column1: 50~Captain America: The First Avenger~Hayley Atwell surprisingly touching Chris Evans' chest
column2: as he emerged from the pod upon turning into Captain America
column3: was very much improvised
column4: and the surprise on her face is genuine
column5: as she admitted in interviews she was very taken by Chris' physique and nearly broke character and ruined the take that made it into the film
column6: as a result.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a15873885481__700.jpg

column1: 51~Bridget Jones's Diary~To prepare for the role
column2: Renée Zellweger gained 25 pounds
column3: and then actually worked at a British publishing company for a month in preparation for the role. She adopted an alias as well as her posh accent and was apparently not recognized. On her desk in this office she kept a framed picture of then boyfriend Jim Carrey. Workers who did not recognize her found this to be odd
column4: but never mentioned it to her for fear of embarrassing her.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a3291fd199f3__700.jpg

column1: 52~Schindler's List~During production
column2: the atmosphere was so grim and depressing that Steven Spielberg asked his friend Robin Williams if he could tell some jokes and do comedy sketches while Spielberg would watch episodes of Seinfeld (1989). Some of Williams' sketches
column3: while played through the speaker phone to the cast and crew
column4: ended up being part of dialogue material for his character in Aladdin (1992)
column5: the Genie.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-44-5a5600fdc909e__700.jpg

column1: 53~The Hangover~In The Hangover
column2: Ed Helms is actually missing a tooth. He never had an adult incisor grow
column3: and his fake incisor was taken out for the parts of filming where Stu's tooth is missing.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b7d4f086057__700.jpg

column1: 54~It~"The Duffer Brothers originally wanted to direct the movie
column2: but were overlooked as they were not ""established"" enough. They went on to create Stranger Things (2016)
column3: which co-stars Finn Wolfhard (Richie) and pays homage to Stephen King."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-115-5a562e98b835b__700.jpg

column1: 55~The Maze Runner~The production had to hire snake wranglers to make sure the areas where they were filming were snake free. Before filming began the wranglers found 25 venomous snakes. The biggest one they found was a 5 foot rattlesnake.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59d772519199a__700.jpg

56~2001: A Space Odyssey~Stanley Kubrick destroyed almost all of his props and sets from 2001: A Space Odyssey because he didn't want them to be used in any lesser science fiction films.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59b79105286b7__700.jpg
57~Inglourious Basterds~"When asked how he got into the violent
column2: baseball bat-wielding mindset of ""The Bear Jew""
column3: Eli Roth partially attributed his performance to the historically accurate costumes: ""Being in wool underwear will make you want to kill anything."" He also stated (in a separate interview) that his girlfriend had secretly added some Hannah Montana (2006) music onto his iPod; when he listened to it
column4: it inexplicably made him able to tap into the violent nature of The Bear Jew."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a27f89a61e7e__700.jpg

column1: 58~The Terminator~"O.J. Simpson was considered for the Terminator
column2: but the producers feared he was ""too nice"" to be taken seriously as a cold-blooded killer."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/interesting-movie-facts-107-5a55ee96b0fd4__700.jpg

column1: 59~What We Do In The Shadows~The man who plays Stu is not an actor but actually Stu Rutherford. A part-time business analyst for a Wellington company
column2: LanWorx. He was hired for the film under the impression that he would be working on computers
column3: and that he would play a small part in the film.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a0da9c1c71ee__700.jpg

column1: 60~The Social Network~"During one of the depositions
column2: it is mentioned that the invention of Facebook made Mark Zuckerberg ""the biggest thing on a campus that included nineteen Nobel Laureates
column3: fifteen Pulitzer Prize winners
column4: two future Olympians
column5: and a movie star."" One of the lawyers then asks
column6: ""Who was the movie star?"" and the response is
column7: ""Does it matter?"" This movie star was
column10: who was enrolled at Harvard from 1999 to 2003 and helped screenwriter Aaron Sorkin by providing him insider information about goings-on at Harvard at the time Facebook first appeared there."~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2016ca7435c__700.jpg

column1: 61~The Phantom Of The Opera~The doll in the Phantom's lair that is supposed to resemble Emmy Rossum is not actually a wax mold. It is Emmy Rossum. This was done by her being made up like a doll with waxy makeup on

column3: very still.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2a8fbe5df46__700.jpg

column1: 66~Now You See Me~Isla Fisher got into difficulty while filming the piranha tank scene. The top of the tank remained opened so that Fisher would be able to swim to the top to get some air
column2: and there was also an emergency lever inside the tank that
column3: if pulled
column4: would alert the crew that she needed help. During one take
column5: Fisher was running out of air
column6: and tried to swim to the top
column7: but the chains on the handcuffs she was wearing got stuck on the bottom of the tank
column8: so she was unable to swim to the top
column9: or pull the lever. She then attempted to alert the crew by hitting the glass of the tank
column10: but since her character is supposed to be panicked and scared in the scene
column11: the crew thought she was acting. She was stuck for three minutes
column12: before the Stunt Coordinator finally realized that something was wrong
column13: after he noticed that her handcuffs were stuck.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59d7760c454c2__700.jpg

column1: 86~Interview With The Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles~All the actors playing vampires were required to hang upside down for up to thirty minutes at a time during the make-up application. This would force all the blood in their bodies to rush to their heads
column2: causing the blood vessels in their faces to bulge out. The make up artists would then trace over the swollen veins creating the eerie translucent-skinned vampire look. Unfortunately for the actors
column3: they would have to repeat the process several times over
column4: as the blood would quickly drain from their heads. This
column5: in part
column6: accounts for the lengthy make-up process.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/Interesting-Movie-Facts-59a96d871659e__700.jpg

column1: 97~Sunshine~Cillian Murphy worked with leading physicist Brian Cox to learn all about advanced physics. This included touring the CERN facility in Switzerland and learned to copy physicists' mannerisms. Murphy ended up copying some of Cox's personal idiosyncrasies
column2: such as his frequent hand movements. The actor also studied Henri-Georges Clouzot's classic The Wages of Fear (1953) to have an understanding of the type of suspense that Danny Boyle was attempting to create. Murphy has claimed that his involvement in Sunshine converted him from agnosticism to atheism.~https://static.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Interesting-Movie-Facts-5a2a5fd332d6c__700.jpg
